title: Cesaro Curve
description: An interactive MicroSim demonstrating the Cesaro curve fractal (torn square) with adjustable recursion depth and size controls.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Mathematics
Geometry
Fractals
learningObjectives: Understand how perpendicular displacement creates fractal patterns
Observe the relationship between recursion depth and pattern complexity
Compare different fractal construction methods (Koch, Levy, Cesaro)
Explore how initial shape affects final fractal appearance

controls.name: recursionSlider
controls.label: Recursion Level
controls.description: Controls the depth of fractal recursion. Higher values create more detailed, lace-like patterns.

controls.name: sizeSlider
controls.label: Size
controls.description: Adjusts the overall size of the curve within the canvas.

equations: Number of segments at level n: S(n) = 12 * 2^(n-1)
assumptions: Starting shape is a square divided into four quadrants
limitations: Maximum recursion level of 7 to prevent performance issues
Displacement ratio is fixed (not adjustable in this version)
